001package io.jstach.jstache;
002
003import java.lang.annotation.Documented;
004import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
005import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
006import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
007import java.lang.annotation.Target;
008import java.util.ServiceLoader;
009
010/**
011 * Place on package to generate a TemplateProvider/JStachioTemplateFinder that will have a
012 * catalog of all public generated JStache templates in the compile time boundary that are
013 * of type {@link JStacheType#JSTACHIO}.
014 * <p>
015 * The class will be put in the annotated package and implements both
016 * <code>io.jstach.jstachio.spi.TemplateProvider</code> and
017 * <code>io.jstach.jstachio.spi.JStachioTemplateFinder</code>.
018 * <p>
019 * This is useful for:
020 *
021 * <ol>
022 * <li>Modular applications that use <code>module-info.java</code> instead of
023 * <code>META-INF/services</code> for service loader registration.</li>
024 * <li>Application wishing to avoid reflection altogether but still wanting to use
025 * JStachio runtime particularly the model to template loookup.</li>
026 * <li>Allow access and rendering of package protected models from other parts of the
027 * application.</li>
028 * </ol>
029 *
030 * <h2>Modular applications</h2>
031 *
032 * Modular applications that do not want to allow reflective access
033 * (<code> open ... to </code>) to the JStachio runtime can instead register the generated
034 * template provider in the <code>module-info.java</code> as a service provider like:
035 *
036 * <pre><code class="language-java">
037 * provides io.jstach.jstachio.spi.TemplateProvider with annotatedpackage.TemplateCatalog;
038 * </code> </pre>
039 *
040 * or as a <code>JStachioTemplateFinder</code>:
041 *
042 * <pre><code class="language-java">
043 * provides io.jstach.jstachio.spi.JStachioTemplateFinder with annotatedpackage.TemplateCatalog;
044 * </code> </pre>
045 *
046 * In general the <code>TemplateProvider</code> is preferred as it will allow reflective
047 * access (either {@link ServiceLoader} or direct constructor reflection) to other models
048 * that are perhaps not in the same compile time boundary as well as caching. Note that
049 * the generated code does not implement caching so if going the
050 * <code>JStachioTemplateFinder</code> route caching will be the implementers
051 * responsibility.
052 *
053 * <strong>Tip:</strong><em>Some tools do not like generated classes being referenced in
054 * <code>module-info.java</code> therefore a general recommendation is to extend the
055 * generated class and reference the class doing the extending in the
056 * <code>module-info.java</code>.</em>
057 *
058 * <h2>Avoiding reflection</h2>
059 *
060 * For those wanting to avoid reflection a custom JStachio can be created from the
061 * generated catalog.
062 *
063 * <pre><code class="language-java">
064 * JStachio j = JStachioFactory.builder()
065 *     .add(new annotatedpackage.TemplateCatalog())
066 *     .build();
067 * </code> </pre>
068 *
069 * <h2>Package protected models</h2>
070 *
071 * If the package annotated has models that are package protected those models will still
072 * be added to the generated template catalog as the generated class will have access.
073 * Normally JStachio uses either the Service Loader which requires public access to the
074 * generated template or reflection which may or may not require public access depending
075 * on modularization.
076 * <p>
077 * <em>Multiple packages can be annotated and thus multiple TemplateProvider/Finder can be
078 * referenced.</em>
079 *
080 *
081 * @author agentgt
082 */
083@Retention(RetentionPolicy.SOURCE)
084@Target({ ElementType.PACKAGE })
085@Documented
086public @interface JStacheCatalog {
087
088        /**
089         * Name of the generated class that will be put in the annotated package.
090         * @return name of the class to be generated. The default is
091         * <code>TemplateCatalog</code>.
092         */
093        public String name() default "TemplateCatalog";
094
095        /**
096         * Configuration flags for generating template catalogs.
097         * @return an array of flags.
098         * @see CatalogFlag
099         */
100        public CatalogFlag[] flags() default {};
101
102        /**
103         * Configuration flags for generating template catalogs such
104         * <code>META-INF/services</code> files.
105         * @author agentgt
106         */
107        public enum CatalogFlag {
108
109                /**
110                 * Option that will generate a legacy service loader registration:
111                 * <code>META-INF/services/io.jstach.jstachio.spi.TemplateProvider</code> pointing
112                 * to the generated template catalog.
113                 */
114
115                GENERATE_PROVIDER_META_INF_SERVICE, //
116
117                /**
118                 * Option that will generate a legacy service loader registration:
119                 * <code>META-INF/services/io.jstach.jstachio.spi.JStachioTemplateFinder</code>
120                 * pointing to the generated template catalog.
121                 */
122                GENERATE_FINDER_META_INF_SERVICE
123
124        }
125
126}
